case_vignette: A 16-year-old female presents to her pediatrician’s office because she has not yet started menstruating. On review of systems, she states that she has been increasingly tired, constipated, and cold over the last 6 months. She also endorses a long history of migraines with aura that have increased in frequency over the last year. She complains that these symptoms have affected her performance on the track team. She states that she is not sexually active. Her mother and sister both underwent menarche at age 15. The patient is 5 feet, 4 inches tall and weighs 100 pounds (BMI 17.2 kg/m^2). Temperature is 98.4°F (36.9°C), blood pressure is 98/59 mmHg, pulse is 98/min, and respirations are 14/min. On exam, the patient appears pale and has thinning hair. She has Tanner stage IV breasts and Tanner stage III pubic hair.
question: Which  would be most useful in determining this patient’s diagnosis?
